annotation: Tang Kristensen recorded these two short folk expressions, the latter a fairly well known proverb. The meaning of the first one is unclear.
danish_manuscript:
A kund for høwest Bestilling ved det gilde og sidde paa
Loftet og kylle Tørv ned.
----
Der vanker ikke Steg til Stakel uden den falder i 
Asken to Gange.
english_manuscript: I could, with the best station at that party, also sit in the loft and toss peat down. (unclear) No one offers roast beef to the poor unless it has fallen into the ash twice. (proverb)
english_publication: Unpublished version reads: I could, with the best position at that party, sit in the attic and toss peat down. (unclear) No one offers roast beef to the poor unless it has fallen into the ash twice. (proverb)
